subject: Politics
title: Rawls and the Veil of Ignorance
description: A micro-lesson that makes Rawls and the Veil of Ignorance usable.

hook.text: Imagine designing society without knowing if you'd be rich or poor. Rawls said that's the only way to be fair.

buildup.text: John Rawls proposed the 'veil of ignorance' ‚Äî design rules without knowing your place in the resulting society.

discovery.text: Behind the veil, rational people would choose equal liberties and only allow inequality that helps the worst off.

twist.text: Critics say people aren't rational behind veils. Nozick argued that justice is about fair process, not outcomes.

climax.text: Rawls shaped modern liberal thought. His 'Theory of Justice' is the most influential political work of the 20th century.

punchline.text: Fairness requires ignorance of privilege. That's the veil's radical insight.

quiz.question: What is Rawls' 'veil of ignorance'?
options: Designing rules without knowing your place in the resulting society
Ignoring all political philosophy when making decisions
A policy of hiding government decisions from the public
